Key Arguments: The legislation threatens freedom of speech and expression by giving power to public servants to censor content.
The exclusion of professional news and political content from the legislation is seen as hypocritical and suggests bias.
The media and government are already involved in spreading misinformation and disinformation.
The bill is viewed as an overreach of government power and a step towards authoritarian censorship.
Notable Quotes: This legislation proposes that the Australian people hand over their liberty and freedoms to Public Servants who will act as a type of Ministry for Truth.
The minute we have a powerful group shutting down everybody else, then we no longer live in a democracy.
The news media and the government are entwined in a vicious circle of mutual manipulation, mythmaking, and self-interest.
